Please enter your height in centimeters

Let's calculate your BMI. Enter your weight in pounds.
Please enter your gender

Please have a look at the Physical Activity Levels to further calculate your TDEE/Maintenance calories:

1. Sedentary
   - Physical Activity Ratio: 1.55
   - Description: Sitting most of the day with no structured exercise

2. Moderately active
   - Physical Activity Ratio: 1.85
   - Description:
     • Sedentary or low active job with 1 hr exercise daily
     • Active job (moderate movement 8+ hrs per day) but no structured exercise

3. Vigorously active
   - Physical Activity Ratio: 2.2
   - Description:
     • Active job (moderate movement 8+ hours per day) and 1 hr exercise per day
     • Sedentary or low active job but 2 hours of exercise daily

4. Extremely active
   - Physical Activity Ratio: 2.4
   - Description:
     • Training more than 2 hrs per day
     • Moderately active job (walking all day) plus at least 1 hr of exercise daily

Please enter the Physical Activity ratio that aligns with your lifestyle the most.
Sure. Please enter your weight in pounds
Please enter your age

To gain weight in a healthy manner, it's important to focus on a balanced diet and regular strength training exercises. Consider increasing your calorie intake by consuming nutrient-rich foods like avocados, nuts, whole grains, and lean proteins. Remember, gaining weight safely is about quality nutrition and consistent exercise.

Gaining weight requires a calorie surplus, but it's crucial to do it healthily. Opt for calorie-dense foods like olive oil, cheese, and fatty fish. Incorporating strength training exercises into your routine can help build muscle mass, contributing to healthy weight gain. It's always best to consult a healthcare provider or dietitian to ensure you're gaining weight in a manner that supports your overall health.

To achieve weight gain effectively, focus on increasing your daily calorie intake by about 250-500 calories per day. Choose nutrient-dense foods such as fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins to meet your increased energy needs. Additionally, participating in resistance training exercises can help you build muscle mass.
You can calculate your maintenance calories, check for suitable exercises and look up nutritional information of food items here too. Simply ask for questions you want the answers to on this chat.
You can also check out this link for additional information.

To embark on a successful weight loss journey, it's crucial to prioritize a balanced diet and regular physical activity. Start by incorporating plenty of fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and whole grains into your meals. Additionally, aim to engage in regular exercise routines such as cardio and strength training. Remember, sustainable weight loss is achieved through healthy lifestyle changes! 🥦🏋️‍♂️

When it comes to losing weight effectively, focusing on a combination of healthy eating habits and regular exercise is key. Try incorporating more fiber-rich foods, such as fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, into your diet while reducing your intake of processed foods and sugary snacks. Pair this with consistent physical activity, such as brisk walking, jogging, or cycling, to help you reach your weight loss goals. Remember, small, sustainable changes lead to long-term success! 🥗🚴‍♀️

Embarking on a journey to lose weight requires commitment to healthy lifestyle changes. Start by creating a balanced meal plan that includes plenty of vegetables, lean proteins, and whole grains, while limiting added sugars and unhealthy fats. Incorporating regular exercise, such as aerobic activities and strength training, can further support your weight loss efforts. Remember, it's about making sustainable changes that you can maintain in the long run! 🍽️💪

You can also look for nutritional information on food items, check out targeted exercises, look up recipes for meals and calculate your tdee/calorie deficit to help you get started out! Just ask questions to the answers you're looking for!
You can also check out this link for additional information.

Your Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE) or Maintenance Calories is: <? ((context.bmr * context.activity_ratio)) ?>

Great! Understanding your Maintenance Calories allows you to set the right calorie intake level for weight loss or weight gain goals. 
Keep in mind that 1 kilogram of body fat is roughly equivalent to 7,700 calories.

For Weight Loss:
- A daily calorie deficit of 500 calories leads to a weekly deficit of 3,500 calories.
- A daily calorie deficit of 700 calories results in a weekly deficit of 4,900 calories.

These deficits should be achieved through a combination of reducing calorie intake and increasing physical activity. Accurate calorie tracking, including measuring and weighing your food portions, is essential for precise calculations.

For Weight Gain:
- A daily calorie surplus of 500 calories results in a weekly surplus of 3,500 calories.
- A daily calorie surplus of 700 calories leads to a weekly surplus of 4,900 calories.

When aiming for weight gain, focus on consuming nutrient-dense foods and engaging in strength training exercises to build muscle mass effectively.

Staying motivated can be challenging, but setting specific goals, finding an exercise you enjoy, and tracking your progress can help keep you motivated and committed to your fitness journey

Remember that fitness is a journey, and results take time. Celebrating small victories, focusing on non-scale victories, and adjusting your goals and strategies can help you stay motivated and committed.

To reignite your passion for fitness, try setting new goals, exploring new workout styles or activities, joining fitness communities for support and inspiration, and reminding yourself of the reasons why you started your fitness journey
Consistency is key in fitness, so scheduling workouts like appointments, finding a workout buddy for accountability, and creating a realistic and sustainable routine can help you stay on track.

Setbacks are a natural part of any journey, including fitness. To stay positive and focused, practice self-compassion, learn from setbacks, adapt your approach as needed, and remember that each day is a new opportunity to make progress and improve.
Plateaus are common, but mixing up your workouts, trying new exercises, and focusing on proper nutrition can help you break through and continue making progress.
